level.heading: Funding for day care provided by D.C. Public Schools.

level.text: In Fiscal Year 2004, the Department may transfer no more than $6 million to the D.C. Public Schools for the purpose of funding an after-school day care program pursuant to a memorandum of understanding. The memorandum of understanding shall include the following program requirements:
Participation in the program shall be based on TANF eligibility;
Verification of family income shall be required before a child may be enrolled in the program;
Priority shall be given to children of families actively participating in TANF;
Additional slots shall be allocated on the sliding scale set forth in ยง 4-405(b); and
Records documenting the costs of the program shall be maintained and provided to the Department on an annual basis, including:
Verifiable data establishing the number of children enrolled by the program;
Documentation that each enrolled child met the eligibility requirements for the program; and
Reports documenting, for each month of operation, the funds expended in relation to service delivery.
